questions.text: Which restaurant did Peter once work at?
questions.explanation:
Burger King.

	In the beginning of this episode, Lois returns home with Stewie after shopping to find Brian on the couch.  She starts suggesting that he get a part-time job to reduce his boredom and give him something to do, and Brian recalls the follies Peter once had at Burger King.  Meanwhile, Meg returns home to tell her family about her new internship at Adam West's office.  Peter dubs Brian the 'new Meg' because of the situation.

questions.text: During Meg's interview with Adam West, what word does she associate with 'mosquito'?
questions.explanation:
Bite.

	In order to get the job as an intern, Meg had to do a simple word association test.  Adam West simply flipped through the words 'Mosquito' and 'Bite' at random and he was satisfied with her skills in answering the same the whole time.Brian finally decides to get a job and he's hired to drive a taxi cab for a company in Quahog.

questions.text: What was the name of the dog that the Griffins had, before they had Brian?
questions.explanation:
Todd.

	Todd was fifteen years old before Peter decided to take him to get put down at the vet's.  Peter talks about Todd when Brian returns home with his new cab.  Peter doesn't mind the idea since he feels that Brian will drive him anywhere he wants, and Brian feels that the cars are much better than the ones on TV that talk with one another.

questions.text: What was the name of Peter and Lois' old band?
questions.explanation:
Handful of Peter.

	When Peter and Brian are driving through Quahog, Peter forces Brian to ram into Lois' car and they shoot out the tires.  This causes her to crash into a grocery store.  Luckily, she doesn't mind this, and it brings their attention to a notice for a talent show.  Peter brings out his old guitar and they decide to start their band, 'Handful of Peter', for the talent show.

questions.text: What does Brian pick up at the convenience store, that causes him to get a parking ticket?
questions.explanation:
Milk.

	On his route, Lois calls Brian to pick up some milk, and he decides to leave Cleveland on the side of the road in order to get his milk.  When he picks it up, he returns to his cab and finds a $400 parking ticket on the windshield.  Since he feels that this is more of a scam than Peter's "Sounds of the Rainforest" CD, he decides to go to the mayor's office and talk to Adam West about it, but Meg advises him against it while Mayor West goes out for pizza (which he fears may be ruined by The Noid).

questions.text: Who turns out to be the mysterious 'Deep Throat' that Brian speaks with?
questions.explanation:
Kermit the Frog.

	In order to prove that Mayor West is corrupt, Brian and Stewie decide to meet the mysterious 'Deep throat' (like the 'Deep Throat' involved in the Watergate Scandal') at a parking complex, but when they talk to the mysterious figure in the shadows, it's clearly Kermit the Frog.  Brian decides to call 'Deep Throat' by his real name and he flees the scene.Meanwhile, Peter and Lois find that their new music is horrible, and that they can't give up on their dream, so they turn to marijuana.

questions.text: Where is it revealed that Mayor West and Meg are a couple?
questions.explanation:
At a motel.

	Brian and Stewie go to Mayor West's office in order to get some more evidence of the mayor's corruption and they end up distracting Meg along the way.  They find his date book and hide out in the motel room next to the one that Adam West took for the night, and when they drilled a hole in the wall, they found Adam West and Meg together.

questions.text: While Peter and Lois are on drugs, who do they end up thinking is an ice cream sundae?
questions.explanation:
Chris.

	While doing more drugs, Peter and Lois go into the kitchen and plan to make cookies, but soon, the walls melt around them and they find themselves in a land of dessert foods.  They start licking away at an ice cream sundae, but this turns out to be Chris sitting on the couch.  Chris later becomes the one to stage an intervention for his parents.

Cleveland.

	When Brian realizes that Meg and Mayor West really like each other, he decides to ruin the evidence of the two together and apologize to Meg for the ordeal.  Meanwhile, Cleveland, still angry about the cab ride from earlier, smashes Brian's cab in the parking lot and escapes as a panther into the night.Meanwhile, Peter and Lois get ready for the talent show.

questions.text: Who hosts the talent show in Quahog?
questions.explanation:
Diane Simmons.

	At the talent show, Peter and Lois appear to gave an excellent performance, but everything seen from their song is a drug-induced hallucination.  Chris later reveals to his parents (after they lose the competition) that they were basically screaming into the microphones.  He decides to warn them about the dangers of marijuana, but in the end, he's interrupted by Stewie trying to watch Mr. Belvedere.
